Fragments.Content:
If FileMaker Pro doesn't find any records that match the find criteria when you perform the script, you can stop the script, continue the script with zero records in the current found set, or change the find criteria. By using the Set Error Capture script step and the Get(LastError) function, you can set up a script to handle such situations. For example:
The following script tries to perform a find. If no records are found, a custom dialog will appear giving the user the option to modify the find request or go back to Browse mode.


Set Error Capture [On]
Perform Find [Restore]
If [Get (LastError) > 0]
Show Custom Dialog ["No records were found. Click OK to modify
your request or click Cancel to return to Browse mode."]
If [Get (LastMessageChoice) = 1]
Modify Last Find
Else
Enter Browse Mode []
End If
End If

STATUS ON 
 OPEN FILE "password"

 FOR a1% = 48 TO 122
    IF a1% > 57 AND a1% < 65 THEN a1% = 65
    IF a1% > 90 AND a1% < 95 THEN a1% = 95
    a1$ = CHR$ (a1%)
 FOR a2% = 48 TO 122
    IF a2% > 57 AND a2% < 65 THEN a2% = 65
    IF a2% > 90 AND a2% < 95 THEN a2% = 95
    a2$ = CHR$ (a2%)
 FOR a3% = 48 TO 122
    IF a3% > 57 AND a3% < 65 THEN a3% = 65
    IF a3% > 90 AND a3% < 95 THEN a3% = 95
    a3$ = CHR$ (a3%)
 FOR a4% = 48 TO 122
    IF a4% > 57 AND a4% < 65 THEN a4% = 65
    IF a4% > 90 AND a4% < 95 THEN a4% = 95
    a4$ = CHR$ (a4%)
    pw$ = a4$ + a3$ + a2$ + a1$
    GOSUB test
 FOR a5% = 48 TO 122
   IF a5% > 57 AND a5% < 65 THEN a5% = 65
   IF a5% > 90 AND a5% < 95 THEN a5% = 95
 a5$ = CHR$ (a5%)
    pw$ = a5$ + a4$ + a3$ + a2$ + a1$
    GOSUB test
 FOR a6% = 48 TO 122
     IF a6% > 57 AND a6% < 65 THEN a6% = 65
    IF a6% > 90 AND a6% < 95 THEN a6% = 95
    a6$ = CHR$ (a6%)
    pw$ = a6$ + a5$ + a4$ + a3$ + a2$ + a1$
    GOSUB test
 FOR a7% = 48 TO 122
      IF a7% > 57 AND a7% < 65 THEN a7% = 65
    IF a7% > 90 AND a7% < 95 THEN a7% = 95
    a7$ = CHR$ (a7%)
    pw$ = a7$ + a6$ + a5$ + a4$ + a3$ + a2$ + a1$
    GOSUB test
 FOR a8% = 48 TO 122
    IF a8% > 57 AND a8% < 65 THEN a8% = 65
    IF a8% > 90 AND a8% < 95 THEN a8% = 95
    a8$ = CHR$ (a8%)
    pw$ = a8$ + a7$ + a6$ + a5$ + a4$ + a3$ + a2$ + a1$
    GOSUB test
 NEXT a8%:NEXT a7%:NEXT a6%:NEXT a5%
 NEXT a4%:NEXT a3%:NEXT a2%:NEXT a1%

test: 
   cnt&% = cnt&% + 1
   cnt$ = STR$ (cnt&%,"999999999")
   statustext = "Attempt: " + cnt$ + ". Trying password " + pw$
   op$ = "MAILS;" + pw$
   st$ = ""
   SET ERROR OFF ALL 
   OPEN FILE op$
   SELECT FIRST 
   st$ = sender
   IF st$ > "" THEN 
        FILE "PASSWORD"
        BLANK 
        pw = pw$
        STORE 
        VIEW 
        END 
    END IF 
    SET ERROR ON ALL 
    RETURN

Fragments.Content:
If you do a setlevel with something in it, the code will only look at the selected part on all next getValue operations
 
You use this for the different party-case-roles for example: you first do a setLevel to select for instance the Insurer, and then you can do getValue to retrieve the Insurer’s address. The code will only look for address tags within the selected Insurer part of the xml
 
You need the setLevel() when done with that selection, in other words when your next getValue is applicable to the full structure again
 
So setLevel (“something”) at some point needs a closing setLevel(). Doing extra setLevel()’s doesn’t make sense
 
startList(“Something”) and endList() do the same but with the extra functionality of looping through the rows

---
setLevel() is needed AFTER you have done a setLevel(“some subset of the xml”) and retrieved some specific values
A setLevel pair allows for any next getValue to have a shorter path and/or to make sure it retrieves exactly what you want
 
<%=setLevel(“OCPartyCaseRole[definedRole//RoleName=‘Claimant’]”)%>
<%=getValue(“Fullname”)%>
<%=setLevel()>
 
Will return the Fullname of the Claimant, as it searches only within XML part dealing with the Claimant
 
Just
<%=getValue(“Fullname”)%>
 
Will return the first Fullname within the complete model, which could be anything
 
You need a closing setLevel() to reset to the complete XML so your next getValue can retrieve something again by searching the complete XML
 
Not sure exactly about your example, but Insured, Broker, Claimant are different party case roles so they likely need a setLevel start and end
Situation of Loss, Policy, Date of Loss, Cause probably not as these are unique within the xml
Fragments.Note: When to use setLevel

Sub GetPictureAviation()
'
' GetPictureAviation Macro
'
'
    If ActiveWindow.View.SplitSpecial <> wdPaneNone Then
        ActiveWindow.Panes(2).Close
    End If
    If ActiveWindow.ActivePane.View.Type = wdNormalView Or ActiveWindow. _
        ActivePane.View.Type = wdOutlineView Then
        ActiveWindow.ActivePane.View.Type = wdPrintView
    End If
    ActiveWindow.ActivePane.View.SeekView = wdSeekCurrentPageHeader
    Selection.Fields.Add Range:=Selection.Range, Type:=wdFieldEmpty, Text:= _
        "INCLUDEPICTURE  ""http://mp3quiz.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/Aviation.png"" " _
        , PreserveFormatting:=True
    Selection.InlineShapes(1).Fill.Visible = msoFalse
    Selection.InlineShapes(1).Fill.Solid
    Selection.InlineShapes(1).Fill.Transparency = 0#
    Selection.InlineShapes(1).Line.Weight = 0.75
    Selection.InlineShapes(1).Line.Transparency = 0#
    Selection.InlineShapes(1).Line.Visible = msoFalse
    Selection.InlineShapes(1).LockAspectRatio = msoTrue
    Selection.InlineShapes(1).Height = 67.7
    Selection.InlineShapes(1).Width = 273.6
    Selection.InlineShapes(1).PictureFormat.Brightness = 0.5
    Selection.InlineShapes(1).PictureFormat.Contrast = 0.5
    Selection.InlineShapes(1).PictureFormat.ColorType = msoPictureAutomatic
    Selection.InlineShapes(1).PictureFormat.CropLeft = 0#
    Selection.InlineShapes(1).PictureFormat.CropRight = 0#
    Selection.InlineShapes(1).PictureFormat.CropTop = 0#
    Selection.InlineShapes(1).PictureFormat.CropBottom = 0#
End Sub

 FOR a1% = 48 TO 122

    IF a1% > 90 AND a1% < 95 THEN a1% = 95
    a1$ = CHR$ (a1%)

    IF a2% > 90 AND a2% < 95 THEN a2% = 95

Fragments.Content:
Show All Records
Sort Records [Specify sort order, Perform without dialog] Sort by Client ID in ascending order
Go to Record/Request/Page [First]
Replace Field Contents [Perform without dialog, Specify target field 'Mark', " "]
Loop
  Set Variable[$id,'ClientID']
  Go to Record/Request/Page [Next, Exit after last]
  If ['$id = ClientID']
     Set Field ['Mark', '"X"']
  Else
     Set Variable[$id,'ClientID']
  End If
End Loop
Perform Find [Restore] Find records when Mark = X


When you perform the script above, the following actions occur:
1. The script find all the records in your databse ans sorts the data by the unique identifer field so that the records with the unique identifier are all grouped together.  In the case of the exampe above, the data is sorted by the ClientID field.
2. Starting with the first record, the script sets a varaible ($id) to the value in the ClientID of the current record
3. The script goes to the next record and compares the value in ClientID to the value stored in the $id variable.  If the values match then the record is assumed to be a duplicate and the script marks the record by putting an "x" in the field called "Mark"
4. The scrpt loops through the remaining records until it reaches the last record in the file.
5. The script finds all records with an "x" in the Mark field, and then displays the found set of the duplicate records.
Deleting the duplicate records
To delete the duplicate records you can manually delete the found set using the Delete Found Records command from the Records menu after running the Find Duplicates script. This way you can control the deleting of records before making any mistakes. If your script works properly to find the duplicate records, you can add the Delete All Records command as the last step to your script. This will automate the entire process for you.
CAUTION: You can't undo the action of deleting records. Use of this script to delete duplicate records should be run on a copy of your database. ALWAYS keep a backup of your database before performing a script that deletes records.
 

Pasted from <http://help.filemaker.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/3441/~/finding-and-deleting-duplicate-records-in-filemaker-pro>
Fragments.Note:
Finding and deleting duplicate records in FileMaker Pro
This article provide a method for identifying and deleting duplicate records from a FileMaker Pro database.  This article uses an example of a travel agency that uses FileMaker Pro file called to keep track of clients that sign up for a cruise.  Each client shoud have a unique ClientID field associated with their record in the FileMaker Pro file.  The FileMaker Pro file contains duplicate records because some clients called the travel agency to sign up, and also mailed in a registration form for the same cruise.
1. Identify or create a unique value for each record - Your database will need a field that uniquely identifies the thing (person, object, concept, etc.) that may be duplicated.  In the example used in this article, the FileMaker Pro file contains records of clients who register for a seminar. Each client has a unique identification number, the "ClientID" field. Some clients have more than one record (the duplicates we are trying to identify), but those records should all have the same ClientID.Data like social security numbers or even email addresses can be used to uniquely identify a record in a database.  If your database does not have a unique identification field, define a calculation field to create one from existing fields. For example, combine first name, last name, and street name to create a unique identifier for each client.
2. Add a field to mark when a duplicate record has been identified - Add a text field, titled "Mark." When the script finds a duplicate record, it places an X in this field to mark the record.
Display the Mark field - Add the Mark field to a layout.

Sub CleanUp()
'
' CleanUp Macro
'
'
    Selection.Find.ClearFormatting
    Selection.Find.Replacement.ClearFormatting
    With Selection.Find
        .Text = "<% "
        .Replacement.Text = "<%"
        .Forward = True
        .Wrap = wdFindContinue
        .Format = False
        .MatchCase = False
        .MatchWholeWord = False
        .MatchWildcards = False
        .MatchSoundsLike = False
        .MatchAllWordForms = False
    End With
    Selection.Find.Execute Replace:=wdReplaceAll
    
    Dim vFindText As Variant
Dim vReplText As Variant
Dim i As Long
Selection.HomeKey Unit:=wdStory
vFindText = Array("[^0145^0146]", "[^0147^0148]")
vReplText = Array("^039", "^034")
With Selection.Find
.ClearFormatting
.Replacement.ClearFormatting
.Forward = True
.Wrap = wdFindContinue
.MatchWholeWord = True
.MatchWildcards = True
For i = LBound(vFindText) To UBound(vFindText)
.Text = vFindText(i)
.Replacement.Text = vReplText(i)
.Execute Replace:=wdReplaceAll
Next i
End With
If ActiveDocument.Saved = False Then ActiveDocument.Save
End Sub

Fragments.Content:
Position(“Mississippi”;“iss”;1;1) returns 2.
Position(“Mississippi”;“iss”;1;2) returns 5.
Position(“Mississippi”;“iss”;3;1) returns 5.
Left(Name;Position(Name;“ “;1;1)-1) returns William, when Name is a text field that contains William Smith.
Right(Name;Length(Name) - Position(Name;“ “;Length(Name);-1)) returns Smith.
Fragments.Note:
Position(text;searchString;start;occurrence)

Parameters 
text - any text expression or text field
searchString - any text expression or text field representing the set of characters you want to find.
start - any numeric expression, or field containing a number, representing the number of characters from the start of the text string at which to begin the search.
occurrence - any numeric expression or field containing a number, representing which instance of the text string you want to find. A negative occurrence value causes the scan to go in the opposite direction from start. A zero value for occurrence is invalid and returns a result of zero.
Data type returned 
number
Originated in 
FileMaker Pro 6.0 or earlier
Description 
This function is not case-sensitive. If searchString isn’t contained in text or if there was no specified occurrence, zero is returned.
Examples

Accounts Coding
Main Version
Do one Transaction dialog that covers Withdrawal/Deposit/Transfer (OR make all three look the same)
	New Transaction
		Auto complete same Account as before
		Auto complete from Date:Date
		Default to Withdrawal but drop down to select Deposit/Transfer - call Withdrawl/Deposit/Script depending on value
		Change HEADER of Form (and colour?) Red - Withdrawl, Green - Deposit, Blue Transfer
			Get current value of 'Cleared' in $Clear
			IF Withdrawal
				Get value of 
				Usual stuff
				If 'Cleared' <> $Clear and Repeating > "A"
					If Repeating = "W"
						$RepDAte = Date + 7
					If Repeating = "M"
						$RepDate = Month +1
					If Repeating = "Y"
						$RepDate = Year +1
				Dupe Record
					Date = $RepDate
					Cleared = ""
			IF Deposit
				If AMount < 0 then Amount = Amount * -1
				If 'Cleared' <> $Clear and Repeating > "A"
					If Repeating = "M"
						$RepDate = Month +1
				Dupe Record
					Date = $RepDate
					Cleared = ""
			IF Transfer open Transfer Dialog
				If 'Cleared' <> $Clear and Repeating > "A"
					If Repeating = "W"
						$RepDAte = Date + 7
					If Repeating = "M"
						$RepDate = Month +1
					If Repeating = "Y"
						$RepDate = Year +1
				Dupe BOTH Records
					Date = $RepDate
					Cleared = ""

Fragments.Content:
Get(LastError)
Purpose 
Returns a number for the error that occurred in the execution of the most recently executed script step.
Format 
Get(LastError)
Parameters 
None
Data type returned 
number
Originated in 
FileMaker Pro 6.0 or earlier

Description 
Use this function to detect and control the outcome of errors. See FileMaker error codes.
Notes 
•macOS: In FileMaker Pro, if an error occurs while performing an AppleScript via the Perform AppleScript (macOS) script step, the AppleScript error code will be returned.
•For ODBC imports and Execute SQL script steps, if an error occurs while performing a SQL query, returns FileMaker error 1408. For detailed information about the error, use the Get(LastExternalErrorDetail) function. If there is no information about the error, returns FileMaker error 1409.
•For working with ODBC data sources in the relationships graph, returns FileMaker error 1408.
•Some script triggers allow for the activating command or event to be canceled if the script executed by the script trigger returns a False value. When a command or event is canceled this way, the error code is set to 20.
•The following control script steps do not clear the last error condition reported by FileMaker Pro: If, Else, Else If, End If, Loop, Exit Loop If, End Loop, Exit Script, and Halt Script.
•For actions that fail to connect to a host because the host’s SSL certificate cannot be verified, this function returns an error code. For detailed information about the error, use the Get(LastExternalErrorDetail) function.
Tip  To create a script that responds to errors without displaying alerts, use this function with the Set Error Capture script step with the On option.
Examples 
Returns 0 when the most recent script step executed successfully.
Returns 401 when no records are found after the Perform Find script step has been executed.
For an example script, see Set Error Capture script step.

CHANGE THE REVISION NUMBER IF YOU CHANGE THIS TEMPLATE 'PLEASE CHANGE THE REVISION NUMBER IF YOU CHANGE THIS TEMPLATE 'PLEASE CHANGE THE REVISION NUMBER IF YOU CHANGE THIS TEMPLATE Public Const RevisionInfo As String = "Template revision 1.34, 8 June 2004" 'PLEASE CHANGE THE REVISION NUMBER IF YOU CHANGE THIS TEMPLATE 'PLEASE CHANGE THE REVISION NUMBER IF YOU CHANGE THIS TEMPLATE 'PLEASE CHANGE THE REVISION NUMBER IF YOU CHANGE THIS TEMPLATE 'PLEASE CHANGE THE REVISION NUMBER IF YOU CHANGE THIS TEMPLATE 'PLEASE CHANGE THE REVISION NUMBER IF YOU CHANGE THIS TEMPLATE Public Const TemplateURLRoot As String = "TemplateURLRoot" Public Const CustomImports As String = "CustomImports" Public Const InitBlockProperty As String = "InitBlock" Public Const ExtendsProperty As String = "Extends" Public Const TablesReformattedProperty As String = "TablesReformatted" Public Const TablesReformatRequiredProperty As String = "TablesReformatRequired" Public Const IsNotTemplateProperty As String = "IsNotTemplate" Sub InsertField() FieldSelectionForm.Show End Sub Sub CompileInWebsite() Dim sURL As String 'Check we know the location in the web site If getCustomProperty(TemplateURLRoot) = "" Then setCustomProperty TemplateURLRoot, "http://www.docprodserver.com/templates/compiled/" PropertyForm.Show End If 'Save as JSP docName = SaveAsJSPWithoutClosing() 'Execute browser and navigate to JSP On Error GoTo shell_error sURL = getCustomProperty(TemplateURLRoot) + "createdoc_" + getNameOnly() + ".jsp" ShellURL sURL 'Close the document ReOpenDocument (docName) Exit Sub shell_error: MsgBox "Error trying to launch " + sURL + " - " + Err.Description Exit Sub End Sub Sub ReOpenDocument(docName As String) nameOnly = getNameOnly() 'Windows(nameOnly + ".tmp").Activate 'ActiveDocument.Close 'Word.Application.Documents.Open (docName) Word.Application.Documents.Open (docName) Documents(nameOnly + ".tmp").Close Windows(docName).Activate End Sub Public Sub EditTemplateURL() PropertyForm.Show End Sub Function getCurName() As String getCurName = LCase(ActiveDocument.name) End Function Function getNameOnly() As String Dim testString As String Dim lastIndex As Integer lastIndex = InStrRev(getCurName(), ".") - 1 testString = Mid(getCurName(), lastIndex, Len(getCurName()) - lastIndex) getNameOnly = Mid(getCurName(), 1, lastIndex) End Function Sub SaveAsJSP() On Error GoTo SaveError Dim sURL As String Dim oShellHandler As Object docName = SaveAsJSPWithoutClosing() ReOpenDocument (docName) 'If Not (getCustomProperty("DocumentTypeSaved") = "True") Then ' if no documenttype has yet been created then navigate to the jsp to create one. ' using ShellEcecuteHandler which will find the users' browser & open. ' On Error GoTo shell_error ' setCustomProperty "DocumentTypeSaved", "True" ' sURL = ParseURL(getCustomProperty("url")) ' ShellURL sURL 'End If Exit Sub SaveError: MsgBox "Problem saving this document (" + Err.Description + ")" Exit Sub shell_error: MsgBox "Error trying to launch " + sURL + " - " + Err.Description Exit Sub End Sub Sub SaveAndCompile() On Error GoTo SaveError docName = SaveAsJSPWithoutClosing() On Error GoTo CompileError CompileTemplate ReOpenDocument (docName) Exit Sub SaveError: MsgBox "Problem saving this document (" + Err.Description + ")" Exit Sub CompileError: MsgBox "Problem invoking the compiler (" + Err.Description + ")" Exit Sub End Sub Function SaveAsJSPWithoutClosing() As String On Error GoTo Save_Error 'Save master template and ensure ActiveDocument has a name 'Force save by setting saved = false to make sure it saves even 'if it thinks its saved already. Getas around word bug by which changing 'only a property doesn't set saved=false thereby the changes get lost 'unless the document text is changed at the same time. ActiveDocument.Saved = False ActiveDocument.Save 'Set the is document parameter to true so script can distinguish 'Note that the template is already saved so doesn't get this property setCustomProperty IsNotTemplateProperty, "True" 'Pass out the document name before it gets mixed up SaveAsJSPWithoutClosing = ActiveDocument.path + "\" + ActiveDocument.name Dim curName, newName, fullName, nameOnly As String Dim lastIndex As Integer fullName = ActiveDocument.path + "\" + ActiveDocument.name curName = getCurName() nameOnly = getNameOnly() htmName = ActiveDocument.path + "\compiled\" + nameOnly + ".tmp" 'Get the last index of "." lastIndex = InStrRev(getCurName(), ".") - 1 jspName = ActiveDocument.path + "\compiled\createdoc_" + Mid(curName, 1, lastIndex) + ".jsp" ' Header file names headerHtmName = ActiveDocument.path + "\compiled\" + nameOnly + "_files\header.htm" headerJspName = ActiveDocument.path + "\compiled\" + nameOnly + "_files\header.jsp" ActiveDocument.SaveAs filename:=htmName, FileFormat:=wdFormatHTML, Password:="", AddToRecentFiles:=False, WritePassword _ :="", ReadOnlyRecommended:=False, EmbedTrueTypeFonts:=False, _ SaveNativePictureFormat:=False, SaveFormsData:=False, SaveAsAOCELetter:= _ False ' Convert the template htm document into a template jsp ConvertHtmToJsp htmName, jspName ' Check to see if there is a header.htm, i.e. that the document has headers and footers If FileExists(headerHtmName) Then ' convert the headersandfooters header.htm into a header.jsp, only if the header.htm exists ConvertHtmToJsp headerHtmName, headerJspName End If Exit Function Save_Error: MsgBox "Error trying to Save: SaveAsJspWithoutClosing : (" + Err.Description + ")" End Function Sub ConvertHtmToJsp(inputHtmFilename As Variant, outputJspFilename As Variant) On Error GoTo ConversionError Open inputHtmFilename For Input As #1 Open outputJspFilename For Output As #2 Dim inBuf As String Dim inLine As String Dim outBuf As String Dim stringToSearch As String Dim firstCharacter As Integer Dim charsetToAdd As String stringToSearch = "Content-Type content=""text/html;" charsetToAdd = " charset=utf-8""" 'looking for charset to put it in jsp page FFO-6651 29/02/2008 While (Not EOF(1)) Line Input #1, inLine firstCharacter = InStr(inLine, stringToSearch) If (firstCharacter > 0) Then charsetToAdd = SubStr(inLine, firstCharacter + Len(stringToSearch), InStrRev(inLine, """")) End If inBuf = inBuf + inLine + Chr(10) Wend outBuf = FixBuffer(inBuf) Dim Extends As String Extends = getCustomProperty(ExtendsProperty) If Extends = "" Then Extends = "com.fineos.frontoffice.components.docprod.DocProdJspBase" End If 'Output standard start code Print #2, "<%--" Print #2, "(c) FINEOS Corporation, all rights reserved" Print #2, RevisionInfo Print #2, "--%>" Print #2, "<%@ page contentType=""text/html;" + charsetToAdd + " autoFlush=""true"" " Print #2, "extends = """ + Extends + """" Print #2, "import = ""java.io.*,com.fineos.frontoffice.bo.*, com.fineos.ta.bo.*,java.text.*,java.util.*," + getCustomProperty(CustomImports) + "com.fineos.ta.persistence.* """ Print #2, "%><% if (request.getParameter(com.fineos.frontoffice.components.docprod.DocProdJspBase.DOC_OID_PARM)==null) {%>" Print #2, "Your Document Production template has compiled and is ready for use. You must use it through the provided user interface.
Continue" Print #2, "<%return;}" Print #2, "try {" Print #2, "OCPostalAddress theAddress = getAddress(pageContext);" Print #2, "OCCase theCase = getCase(pageContext);" Print #2, "Rel theContactedParties = getContactedParties(pageContext);" 'fix for FFO-1653 brennanr 17/08/2005 Print #2, "OCPerson theContactedPerson = null;" Print #2, "try {" Print #2, "theContactedPerson = getContactedPerson(pageContext);" Print #2, "} catch(ClassCastException e) {}" 'end of FFO-1653 Print #2, "OCDocument theDocument = getDocument(pageContext);" Print #2, "OCExtraData theFormData = getFormData(pageContext);" Print #2, "OCContactBase theContact = getContact(pageContext);" Print #2, getCustomProperty(InitBlockProperty) Print #2, " %>" Print #2, outBuf 'Output standard end code Print #2, "<%} catch(Exception e) { out.print(e) ; e.printStackTrace(); throw e; } %>" Close #1 Close #2 Exit Sub ConversionError: MsgBox "Error trying to Convert htm to jsp: ConvertHtmToJsp : (" + Err.Description + ")" End Sub Private Function FileExists(filename As Variant) ' Returns a boolean - True if the file exists Dim fileSystemObject Set fileSystemObject = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") FileExists = fileSystemObject.FileExists(filename) End Function Function FixBuffer(inputStr As String) As String Dim outString As String Dim thisBlock As String Dim jspBlock As String Dim jspStartTag As Long Dim jspEndTag As Long Dim tagLen As Long On Error GoTo fixBuffer_ERR tagLen = 5 outString = "" jspStartTag = 0 jspEndTag = 1 - tagLen If InStr(1, inputStr, "<%") = 0 Then FixBuffer = inputStr Exit Function End If 'Before processing JSP blocks, replace encoded JSP start and end tags 'within hyperlinks which are encoded differently inputStr = Replace(inputStr, "..\%3C%25", "<%") inputStr = Replace(inputStr, "%25%3E", "%>") Do '<% is encoded when the htm file is saved jspStartTag = InStr(jspEndTag + tagLen, inputStr, "<%") If jspStartTag = 0 Then thisBlock = Mid(inputStr, jspEndTag + tagLen) outString = outString + thisBlock Exit Do Else '%> is encoded when the htm file is saved beforeblock = SubStr(inputStr, jspEndTag + tagLen, jspStartTag - 1) jspEndTag = InStr(jspStartTag, inputStr, "%>") ' FFO-9004: Added check to see if opening <% is closed If jspEndTag = 0 Then MsgBox ("An Error occurred: FixBuffer, An open jsp scriptlet tag (<%) exists and is not closed. A closing scriptlet (%>) is required before this document can be saved as a JSP") Exit Function Else jspBlock = SubStr(inputStr, jspStartTag, jspEndTag + tagLen - 1) jspBlock = FixJspBlock(jspBlock) If Left(jspBlock, 13) = "<%=startList(" Then jspBlock = jspBlock & "<%for (int i = 0; i < getCurrentNodeList().getLength(); i++) {Node node = getCurrentNodeList().item(i);if (node.getNodeType() == Node.ELEMENT_NODE) {setCurrentElement((Element) node);%>" ElseIf Left(jspBlock, 11) = "<%=endList(" Then jspBlock = "<%}}%>" & jspBlock ElseIf Left(jspBlock, 12) = "<%=elseList(" Then jspBlock = "<%}} if (getCurrentNodeList().getLength()==0) {{%>" & jspBlock End If thisBlock = beforeblock + jspBlock outString = outString + thisBlock End If End If Loop While True FixBuffer = outString Exit Function fixBuffer_ERR: MsgBox ("An Error occurred: FixBuffer, " + Err.Description) End Function Function SubStr(str As String, fromI As Long, toI As Long) As String SubStr = Mid(str, fromI, toI - fromI + 1) End Function Function RemoveTag(buf As String, TagToGo As String) As String 'return the supplied string with the tag removed, possible values for tag are ' will be found and the tag removed Dim startTagPos As Long Dim endPos As Long On Error GoTo RemoveTag_ERR startTagPos = InStr(buf, TagToGo) If startTagPos > 0 Then ' find closing > endPos = InStr(startTagPos, buf, ">") If (endPos > 0) Then ' remove that much from the buffer ans = Left(buf, startTagPos - 1) ans = ans + Right(buf, Len(buf) - endPos) Else ' couldn't find the trailing > thing is *ucked ans = buf End If Else ans = buf End If RemoveTag = ans Exit Function RemoveTag_ERR: MsgBox ("An Error has occurred, RemoveTag : " + Err.Description) End Function Function FixJspBlock(inputString As String) As String Dim outString As String Dim toProcess As String outString = inputString 'Decode encoded characters outString = Replace(outString, "’", "'") outString = Replace(outString, "<", "<") outString = Replace(outString, ">", ">") outString = Replace(outString, "“", """") outString = Replace(outString, "”", """") outString = Replace(outString, """, """") outString = Replace(outString, Chr$(160), "") outString = Replace(outString, "&&", "&&") 'remove new lines within jsp tags (cannot split single statements over multiple lines) outString = Replace(outString, Chr(10), " ") outString = RemoveAllTag(outString, " toProcess) ' it changed toProcess = ans ans = RemoveTag(toProcess, TagToGo) Wend RemoveAllTag = ans End Function Public Function setCustomProperty(name As String, newValue As String) On Error GoTo setCustomProperty_ERR Dim Index As Long Dim pos As Long Dim blockSize As Integer Dim tmpName As String Dim tmpValue As String blockSize = 200 pos = 1 Index = 1 While (pos <= Len(newValue)) tmpValue = SubStr(newValue, pos, Min(pos + blockSize - 1, Len(newValue))) tmpName = name + str(Index) setSimpleProperty tmpName, tmpValue pos = pos + blockSize Index = Index + 1 Wend 'Blank out higher index value properties For Each prop In ActiveDocument.CustomDocumentProperties tmpName = name + str(Index) If prop.name = tmpName Then prop.Value = "" Index = Index + 1 End If Next Exit Function setCustomProperty_ERR: MsgBox ("Error setting Custom Property, " + Err.Description) End Function Private Sub setSimpleProperty(name As String, newValue As String) For Each prop In ActiveDocument.CustomDocumentProperties If prop.name = name Then prop.Value = newValue Exit Sub End If Next 'If we can't find it, add it With ActiveDocument.CustomDocumentProperties .Add name:=name, _ LinkToContent:=False, _ Type:=msoPropertyTypeString, _ Value:=newValue End With End Sub Public Function getCustomProperty(name As String) On Error GoTo getCustomProperty_ERR Dim Index As Integer Dim tmpName As String Dim multiValue As String Dim simpleValue As String Index = 1 multiValue = "" simpleValue = "" For Each prop In ActiveDocument.CustomDocumentProperties tmpName = name + str(Index) If prop.name = name Then simpleValue = prop.Value End If If prop.name = tmpName Then multiValue = multiValue + prop.Value Index = Index + 1 End If Next If multiValue = "" Then getCustomProperty = simpleValue Else getCustomProperty = multiValue If simpleValue <> "" Then 'blank out previous simple value setSimpleProperty name, "No longer used" End If End If Exit Function getCustomProperty_ERR: MsgBox ("Error occurred setting Custom Property" + Err.Description) End Function Sub AboutBbox() MsgBox "FINEOS Document Production, " + RevisionInfo + ", (c) FINEOS Corporation, all rights reserved" End Sub Private Function ParseURL(ByVal sURL As String) As String On Error GoTo ParseURL_ERR Const TEMPLATE As String = "" Dim sNewURL As String Dim lpos As Long lpos = InStr(1, sURL, TEMPLATE, vbTextCompare) If (lpos <> 0) Then sNewURL = Mid(sURL, 1, lpos - 1) & ActiveDocument.name End If ParseURL = sNewURL Exit Function ParseURL_ERR: MsgBox ("Error Parsing URL, " + Err.Description) End Function Private Function Min(a As Long, b As Long) As Long If a < b Then Min = a Else Min = b End If End Function 'Autoformats all tables in the document based on the default table 'properties in the document. Often needed as the inserted data 'is a different size that the code block in the template Sub AutoFormatTables() 'Don't show please wait dialogue, only runs on server anyway 'PleaseWait.Show vbNonModal DoEvents 'Word97 Compatible table reformat For Each aTable In ActiveDocument.Tables aTable.AutoFormat AutoFit:=True Next 'PleaseWait.Hide End Sub Private Sub ShellURL(URL As String) Dim iexplore As Object Set iexplore = CreateObject("InternetExplorer.Application") iexplore.Visible = True iexplore.navigate2 URL End Sub

Fragments.Content:
Sub Database()
    Dim rwIndex As Long
    Dim colIndex As Long
    Dim Scheme As String
    Dim Service As String
    Dim Answer As String
    Dim Format As String
    Dim rwIndex2 As Long
    Dim colIndex2 As Long
    Dim AnswerIndex As Long
    Dim RowCounter As Long
    Dim ColCounter As Long
    Dim Counter As Long
    Dim ws1 As Worksheet, ws2 As Worksheet    Set ws1 = Worksheets("1")
    Set ws2 = Worksheets("2")    With Application
        .ScreenUpdating = False
        .EnableEvents = False
    End With    rwIndex2 = 1
    Counter = Counter + 1
    For rwIndex = 2 To 634
    Counter = Counter + 1
        For colIndex = 2 To 233
        Counter = Counter + 1
            Scheme = ws1.Cells(rwIndex, 1)
            Service = ws1.Cells(1, colIndex)
            If ws1.Cells(rwIndex, colIndex) > "" Then
                Answer = ws1.Cells(rwIndex, colIndex)
                Format = ws1.Cells(rwIndex, colIndex).NumberFormat
                rwIndex2 = rwIndex2 + 1
                colIndex2 = 1
                ws2.Cells(rwIndex2, colIndex2) = Scheme
                ws2.Cells(rwIndex2, colIndex2 + 1) = Service
                ws2.Cells(rwIndex2, colIndex2 + 2) = Answer
                ws2.Cells(rwIndex2, colIndex2 + 3) = Format
            Else
            End If
            ws1.Select
         Next colIndex
    Next rwIndex    With Application
        .ScreenUpdating = True
        .EnableEvents = True
    End With
End Su

Snippets.Title: Excel Search and Replace CR Character

Fragments.Content:
Sub Neil()
    'Replaces ; in columns 1,2,3 & 4 with Chr(10) for ALL Sheets    Dim RowC As Integer
    Dim ColC As Integer
    Dim SNum As Integer    For SNum = 1 To Sheets.Count        RowC = 1
        Do While Sheets(SNum).Cells(RowC, 1).Value <> ""            For ColC = 1 To 4                Sheets(SNum).Cells(RowC, ColC).Value = Replace(Sheets(SNum).Cells(RowC, ColC).Value, ";", Chr(10))            Next            RowC = RowC + 1        Loop    Next
End Sub
Fragments.Title: Fragment

Snippets.Title: Export Container Picture field for all records

Fragments.Content:
Go to Record/Request/Page [First]
Loop
   Set Variable [$filePath; Value: Get ( DesktopPath ) MyPics::Description & ".jpg"]
   Export Field Contents [MyPics::Picture; “$filePath”]  
       Go to Record/Request/Page [Next; Exit after last]
End Loop
Fragments.Note: Goes through all records exporting a single container field
